meanings.sent1: The tectum of the midbrain helps protect important parts.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the tectum to understand brain functions.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bird built a nest on the tectum of the tree.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a tectum, sheltering thoughts from the storm of distractions.
meanings.sent5: In the anatomy class, students learned about the tectum's role in the brain.

meanings.sent1: The tectum shielded the delicate equipment from harm.
meanings.sent2: Workers wore helmets as a tectum in the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella acted as a tectum against the raindrops.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a tectum, guarding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The thick walls served as a tectum, keeping the house safe from the storm.

meanings.sent1: The wooden tectum covered the outdoor stage beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The gazebo had a lovely tectum adorned with flowers.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot under the tectum of the shed.
meanings.sent4: His dreams soared under the tectum of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The ancient temple's tectum was intricately designed with carvings.
